title: Nonlinear Least Squares (NLS) Model
IndependentVarsformula: Build or Paste any equation (formula) with Independent (predictor) variable(s) and model parameters e.g. a * exp(b * x) where a and b are parameters to be estimated and x is the predictor variable. it will create a model equation as y ~ a * exp(b * x) where y is response variable
IndependentVar: An independent (predictor) variable needed for scatter and fitted plot
weights: A variable used as weight (Y) with a power value
PowerKweight: Power: for just Y, choose (-1), for 1/Y, choose 1, 1/(Y^2), choose 2, .. 1/(Y^5), choose 5,..
resNormalityTestChk: Normality test of the model residuals
modelConstraintLabel: (Optional) Various Model constraints for parameter estimations
pmodels: Starting values for parameters to guide model optimization/convergence e.g. param1 = 1, param2 = 10, param3 = 0 for a three parameter model
paramConstraintsLower: Set the constraint for lower limit (must choose port as algorithm) e.g. 3, -Inf, -Inf for a three parameter model
paramConstraintsUpper: Set the constraint for upper limit (must choose port as algorithm) e.g. 3, Inf, Inf, 2 for a four parameter model
algorithm: Algorithm to use. The default is a Gauss-Newton algorithm
maxIter: Maximum number of iterations allowed for model to converge. Default is 50
logScaleAxis: X axis is plotted in log scale by default. Choose ' ' for original scale
doseInLogScaleChk: Check if the dose/concentration is already in logarithmic values in the dataset

help.title: Nonlinear Least Squares (NLS) Model
help.body:
Description
Perform nonlinear regression. Build or type in any equation (formula) to build the nonlinear regression model. Determine the nonlinear (weighted) least-squares estimates of the parameters of the nonlinear model. Analyze model fit with graphs.

Check help(nls, package ='stats') for details

You can try this dialog

Example 1
Load dataset DNase from Load Datasets menu (leave all installed packages in the first dropdown and choose DNase from the second dropdown)
Choose (or drag) density as response variable
Type Asym/(1 + exp((xmid - log(conc))/scal)) in the Independent (formula) field where Asym, xmid, and scal are three model parameters (i.e. coefficients) to be estimated
Check Estimated Covariance Matrix
Check Plot fitted and residuals
Choose (or drag) conc into the field An independent (predictor) variable needed for scatter and fitted plot
Type in Asym = 3, xmid = 0, scal = 1 in the field Starting values for parameters to guide model

Example 2
Load dataset DNase from Load Datasets menu (leave all installed packages in the first dropdown and choose DNase from the second dropdown)
Choose (or drag) density as response variable
Type Asym/(1 + exp((xmid - log(conc))/scal)) in the Independent (formula) field
Check Estimated Covariance Matrix
Check Plot fitted and residuals
Choose (or drag) conc into the field An independent (predictor) variable needed for scatter and fitted plot
Type in Asym = 3, xmid = 0, scal = 1 in the field Starting values for parameters to guide model
Type in Asym = 0, xmid = -Inf, scal = -Inf in the field constraint for lower limit (set lower limit for Asym to 0, and leave the lower limit of xmid and scal unconstraint)
Type in Asym = Inf, xmid = 4, scal = Inf in the field constraint for upper limit (set lower limit for xmid to 0, and leave the upper limit of Asym and scal unconstraint)
choose port from the dropdown of algorithm to use instead of default

Execute the dialog
